channel.title: Need a program
channel.description: Ok, me and a friend are making a batch file, it is currently 74000 lines long, and there are a lot of repeat lines, does any one know of a program that can find a duplicate line and delete it? All the lines are set up like "echo %var% site >> %var%" and there are just to many lines to go throgh by hand.

item.title: Need a program
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Aren’t batch files written in notepad? If so just use the option replace or replace all.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a program
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

kishimojin:

Ok, me and a friend are making a batch file, it is currently 74000 lines long, and there are a lot of repeat lines, does any one know of a program that can find a duplicate line and delete it? All the lines are set up like “echo %var% site >> %var%” and there are just to many lines to go throgh by hand.

You have a batch file that’s 74000 lines long…? May I ask what it is supposed to do?

Read full topic

item.title: Need a program
item.dc:creator: @blackfangs9 blackfangs9
item.description:
@blackfangs9 wrote:

well there are programs on google that can scan and delete any unneeded files but youd have to find the right one and trust it
